Summary A recognized industry innovator and award-winning creative, Suzana has vast experience working with top brands including Coca-Cola, Fiat, Google, Red Bull, Unilever, Pampers, Converse. 
 
Over the past decade, Suzana has had a significant impact on the digital landscape of the Brazilian and international market. 
 
She began her advertising career as a copywriter in Rio de Janeiro at one of Brazil’s pioneering digital agencies. While there, she took part in the creation of “My City”, one of the first global web-art exhibitions.  
 
In 2000, she moved to Sao Paulo and worked as Creative Director at some of the largest and most respected digital agencies in the world, including AgenciaClick and JWT. In 2005, she took on the challenge of infusing Africa (a large, traditional agency) with digital culture and creative excellence. Two years later, the agency won second place in the “Interactive Agency of the Year” category at the Cannes Festival.  
 
Following these successes, Suzana became a partner and CCO of Hello Interactive, an agency owned by the Brazilian ABC Group . In 2010, Suzana moved to New York to work as ECD of StrawberryFrog. She then went to Anomaly where she spent two years leading innovation projects and digital campaigns for clients such as Converse, AMEX, P&G and Marriott (Renaissance Hotels).  
 
In parallel to her advertising work, Suzana belongs to a collective in Brazil called “Asas da Imaginação”, which is a group of twelve people from countries around the world, who collaborate both virtually and physically to bring to life special projects of arts and culture. 
 
 
RECOGNITION 
 
Suzana won 19 international awards including Cyber Lions at Cannes Festivals, pencils at One Show Interactive and a Grand Prix at the London International Awards.  
 
Served as a juror at top advertising shows such as Cannes Lions, One Show Interactive, Andy Awards, D&AD, Webby Awards, Effies, Fiap.

Summary Leslie combines her experience in advertising, storytelling, digital and film to help brands connect with people. She started her creative career in the U.S at advertising agency Wieden & Kennedy, working on Nike and Coca Cola. She then moved to London, went to film school and combined both advertising and filmmaking to grow brands VW, MTV and 3 Hutchinson. In 2005, she was invited to join Partizan London full-time to write and direct commercials for UK-based clients Wieden & Kennedy, MTV, Channel 5 and TBWA.  
 
Over the years Leslie’s developed a taste for absurd comedy, strong narrative and a reputation for giving funny a sense of style. After shooting her first short in 2008, Leslie joined WARP for music videos as well. 
 
Interesting branded content opportunities followed; Leslie worked in Shanghai at Wieden & Kennedy to help launch Nike in China, and in Australia to run brands IKEA and Yahoo7!. In 2010, Leslie was poached by digital consultancy HOST to help run and service the branded content needs of clients Air New Zealand, Coca Cola and Vodafone. After which she began developing and producing content and platforms straight to clients like Google Creative Labs Sydney and The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. Leslie now finds herself back in the working on production-led projects for friends at Google Creative Lab, RSA Films, Mother NY, Mekanism, BBH and 72andSunny Los Angeles.  
Since the beginning of the year Leslie's become increasingly involved in developing a digital platform to address the social problems working parents face identified by Whynotthinktank - a think tank she and co-founder Rachael Ellison founded in 2013.  
 
Leslie's personal work has been recognized and awarded by the Sundance Film Festival, FWA, D&AD, Cannes, Award, Creativity, the BTA, the One Show, Creative Review and Boards Magazine. Summary This is my page, so I edit it the way I want. It feels good to be free.  
 
I've been in the industry for a while now: first as a content editor for TV and digital, and for the last 12 years, as a Creative Director.  
 
For the last four years, I have built and managed Google’s Creative Team in Brazil, The Zoo, as a Creative Director. That's my current do. Our mission is to work closely with brands and agencies using Google’s Pandora box of technology to help them envision and shape more engaging campaigns. 
 
Prior to Google, I had my own creative digital shop in Brazil, Vinil, from 2004 to 2011. Small in size, but huge in determination and passion. My only desire was to go deep on interesting experiences for people and take brands from a monologue to a dialogue. 
 
I made it. Had the chance to build a creative business from scratch and work with powerful brands, cool brands, hypster brands and not very cool brands. Lots of interesting work, learnings, but little time for self promotion and it was a huge time investment: 7 years of no vacations, late nights, and weekends-- but I was full of energy and inspiration.  
 
Those were tough times. It was the beginning of the digital age for everyone. And for brands and agencies there was no successful stories to imitated, or to “get inspired by”; no track of results, it was a black hole (not a white board). It took a while for the advertising and design industry to understand that “digital” was not just a bunch of programmers coding or playing games, it was part of the entire world we live in-- a fully connected world with no boundaries. 
 
Today, digital is pure joy waiting to be experienced and embedded in people’s life and brands communication.  
 
And my purpose in life is to be happy and work hard with inspiring and brave people, invest my precious time in initiatives that can somehow enhance people’s life, including, mine.

Summary Born in Poland, in 1976, Quba Michalski is a Motion Artist, Director, Problem Solver and Creative Thinker with over two decades of experience in various disciplines of design. His current area of interest and expertise revolves mostly around stereoscopic 360 filmmaking and storytelling as well as virtual reality. 
 
He begun his adventure with the world of design at the age of 12, when his father smuggled the first Macintosh computer to then-embargoed Poland. With the machine running Swedish OS and software and Polish designers never exposed to GUI-based software, Quba ended up figuring out how to use the computer and then training the Academy of Fine Arts graduates at the Poland’s first desktop publishing studio. 
 
Over the years, Quba trained himself in various disciplines of design - from DTP through interactive and web design, photography, cinematography to motion design, visual effects and compositing. 
His unique, multi-faceted approach is a result of a wide array of interests (from gaming, coding, design and film-making to automation, psychology, quantum physics and anthropology to name just a few), combined with a multi-cultural upbringing (Quba left Poland at the age of 16 and has spent a majority of his life in various cities across Europe, Middle East and finally the US). 
 
Quba is best known for his ability to analyze or create new projects, observe them from multiple perspectives, and develop practical solutions. With his wide area of expertise, he is able to quickly identify potential future problems and remedy them in advance through smart planning and adjustments.
